title: Unmanned Aerial Systems Researcher
organization: School of AMME, University of Sydney
description:
- Developed a novel magnetodynamic framework for UAV-based bird deterrence, achieving ~91% effectiveness with a biomimetic "wolf-pack" algorithm (vs ~65% with traditional pursuit methods).
- Designed and implemented a simulation environment integrating physics-based flock modeling, multiple herding algorithms, and real-time state estimation; validated with trials using 10 Tello EDU drones.
- Created a high-performance C++ swarm control and calibration toolkit for distributed aerial systems, addressing limitations in existing Python-based solutions. Preparing findings for publication in a robotics journal.

title: Mechatronics Intern
organization: Rio Tinto Centre for Mining Automation
description:
- Developed an adaptive sampling method that demonstrated a theoretical 40% cost reduction for data collection (versus industry-standard techniques) on a mine site, while maintaining or reducing model uncertainty.
- Applied advanced probabilistic modeling (Gaussian Processes, Random Forests) to mine geology data, achieving 80%+ accuracy in ore grade prediction with quantified uncertainty estimates.
- Designed and validated intelligent sample placement algorithms that yielded a 50% improvement in information gained per sample compared to uniform sampling; co-authored a publication (pending patent approval).

title: Summer Research Scholar
description:
- Researched change detection and mapping techniques, investigating state-of-the-art machine learning methods and presenting findings to academic and industry audiences.
- Trained a neural network for underwater change detection, overcoming challenges from variable water conditions, lighting, and lack of rigid structures.

title: Research Assistant
organization: School of Physics, University of Sydney
description:
- Worked on projects with the Photonics & Fibre Optics group (ARC Centre of Excellence in Exciton Science) and the Solar Energy Research Group, tackling cutting-edge problems in photonics and materials science.
- Led a special research project on energy harvesting in fibers and wearable technology, determining that current piezoelectric, thermoelectric, and triboluminescent methods in nanofibers cannot power low-energy devices given present fabrication techniques.
- Investigated the use of Metal-Organic Framework glass to stabilize perovskite solar cells, demonstrating strong electrical performance and improved stability against environmental stressors (air, moisture, sunlight).
